comment: One of the easiest classes you'll take. SBs are time consuming but not impossible, labs have unlimited attempts. Only the quizzes are proctored but if you take the self quiz it shows you the exact questions that'll be on the test. You can complete it at your own pace. If you're a self sufficient learner you'll be fine.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: The workload is ridiculous for what the class is. Some of the smartbook assignments have 100+ concepts.

This class is very time consuming but easy. You have 5 assignments per unit and the SB alone takes 3 hours. The quizzes are easy to pass if you take the self quiz. The quizzes are also proctored. This was the most time consuming class I have ever taken.

I am still currently in the class. The class is kind of easy but there is a lot of work to do. The SB's are ridiculous though. Like I mean it takes 4 hours to do it. That is way to long for an assignment. The main tests for each chapter are easy if you study the self quiz. Not sure what grade i'm gonna get with all this work however.

All the work was completed through Connect & was very time consuming. However, if you pace yourself, you can definitely get an A. You get 5 attempts on the labs and the quizzes are proctored, so you definitely need to understand the material. He gives you roughly 2 weeks to complete an SB, lab, and the quiz. He hardly responds to student questions.

I took his class online and it was extremely difficult. We had to do labs, SB quizzes (which will take a MINIMUM of 2+ hours), Self quizzes, and the actual quiz at the end of every chapter. He also required that we use a lockdown browser called proctorio that was also difficult to access.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: He just opened all of the assignments for the year and vanished. It was hard to contact him and the work load was annoyingly time consuming. We had SB's that took up to 4 hours maybe more to complete, 20-30 question labs, and a 40-50 question test to end that unit. You have to do this 9 times. I clinched an A but it was not without struggles
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: In the beginning of the school, I was so confused with his class because he didn't send instructions or have online sessions. Once I caught on, I understood this was a class where you read the textbook on your own. I eventually found my way around the class while using Socratic HEAVY and ended up barely clinching a A. If you take him, use Socratic
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: anasynchronous class! About every 10 days, 3 assignments were due: lab, test, and SB assignment. Definitely not an easy class. You really have to work for your grade and be willing to read! You can finish the class early if you want as well. Do the extra credit! More of a self taught class. Does email/call if needed! No midterm or final!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took this class because I thought it would be interesting to learn about geography, but he makes everything so tedious. He basically unlocks assignments and disappears for the semester. He doesn't communicate at all and everything is out of the book. He doesn't actually teach at all. Expect a lot of work and a lot of frustration.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: So I was pretty optimistic going into this class. I mean who wouldn't want to learn about the different types of soil right? Sike. There was no mention in the syllabus of a whole mountain load of homework each week, pun intended. The syllabus said this course would change the way I look at the Earth, well I never even looked at it anyways.

I have never seen a more absent and lazy educator in my life. The professor would not reply to any means of communication since the first week. I took this course online and all his quizzes have a lockdown browser. The chapters and quizzes are incredibly long and tedious. I hope he reads this sometime and realizes he is dreadful educator.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: The textbook itself is a mess on it's own. The material is good stuff though and many supplemental learning materials are provided. So much easy stuff is assigned that if you miss one or two (and score well on grades), you can pass the class. I wish there was field trip or two though.

I literally made this account just to rate this professor. This is the first professor I have come across that has genuinely been absent. The professor set up the online quizzes and chapters, and since the first week, he has been gone. We have posted repeatedly in the discussions (primary contact) but no reply. WARNING! DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: The class was a complete disappointment, labs were difficult due to errors with the program, 5 attempts are given, so 100 is easy. Prof. was great, called me on a Saturday to walk me through a lab I was struggling to complete. The text was informational and easy to follow. Use the practice tests to study for exams.
